main event: A round object, the size of a volleyball, with a reddish glow and white blinking lights was sighted 20 degrees above the horizon in Bremerton, Washington on October 6, 1957, observed for 10-15 seconds.
interesting points: The observation was made by a civilian and reported to Project Blue Book in a handwritten document with notes and observations.
The object was described as spherical, with a reddish glow and white blinking lights, and the size of a volleyball.
The sighting occurred at dusk with overcast clouds, and it was noted that there may have been a few breaks in the clouds up to a 15,000 ft ceiling.
The trajectory and movement of the unidentified object were depicted in a hand-drawn diagram, but no photograph was included in the report.
The report was passed by a duty watch officer of the 13th Naval District, indicating military involvement in the investigation.
sighted object: a round object with a reddish glow and white blinking lights
witnesses: civilian, duty watch officer of the 13th Naval District
